about.summary: A tool for exploring correlations. It makes it possible to easily perform routine tasks when exploring correlation matrices such as ignoring the diagonal, focusing on the correlations of certain variables against others, or rearranging and visualising the matrix in terms of the strength of the correlations.

name: r-corrr
raw_meta_yaml:
{% set version = "0.4.2" %}
{% set posix = 'm2-' if win else '' %}
{% set native = 'm2w64-' if win else '' %}

package:
  name: r-corrr
  version: {{ version|replace("-", "_") }}

source:
  url:
    - {{ cran_mirror }}/src/contrib/corrr_{{ version }}.tar.gz
    - {{ cran_mirror }}/src/contrib/Archive/corrr/corrr_{{ version }}.tar.gz
  sha256: d2a1a24bd26ebcd2c761666869b2c27e69ba382a7ed45caa61795a55f5de66d6

build:
  merge_build_host: true  # [win]
  number: 1
  noarch: generic
  rpaths:
    - lib/R/lib/
    - lib/

requirements:
  build:
    - {{ posix }}zip               # [win]
  host:
    - r-base
    - r-dplyr >=0.8.0
    - r-ggplot2 >=2.2.0
    - r-ggrepel >=0.6.5
    - r-lazyeval >=0.2.0
    - r-magrittr >=1.5
    - r-purrr >=0.2.2
    - r-rlang >=0.2.0
    - r-seriation >=1.2_0
    - r-tibble >=2.0
    - r-tidyr >=0.5.1
  run:
    - r-base
    - r-dplyr >=0.8.0
    - r-ggplot2 >=2.2.0
    - r-ggrepel >=0.6.5
    - r-lazyeval >=0.2.0
    - r-magrittr >=1.5
    - r-purrr >=0.2.2
    - r-rlang >=0.2.0
    - r-seriation >=1.2_0
    - r-tibble >=2.0
    - r-tidyr >=0.5.1

test:
  commands:
    - $R -e "library('corrr')"           # [not win]
    - "\"%R%\" -e \"library('corrr')\""  # [win]

about:
  home: https://github.com/drsimonj/corrr
  license: MIT
  license_file: LICENSE
  summary: A tool for exploring correlations. It makes it possible to easily perform routine tasks when exploring correlation matrices such as ignoring the diagonal,
    focusing on the correlations of certain variables against others, or rearranging and visualising the matrix in terms of the strength of the correlations.
  license_family: MIT

extra:
  recipe-maintainers:
    - conda-forge/r
    - apcamargo

# Package: corrr
# Type: Package
# Version: 0.3.1
# Title: Correlations in R
# Description: A tool for exploring correlations. It makes it possible to easily perform routine tasks when exploring correlation matrices such as ignoring the diagonal, focusing on the correlations of certain variables against others, or rearranging and visualising the matrix in terms of the strength of the correlations.
# Author:  Simon Jackson [aut, cre], Jorge Cimentada [ctb], Edgar Ruiz [aut]
# Maintainer: Edgar Ruiz <edgararuiz@gmail.com>
# URL: https://github.com/drsimonj/corrr
# BugReports: https://github.com/drsimonj/corrr/issues
# Depends: R (>= 3.3.0)
# LazyData: yes
# License: MIT + file LICENSE
# RoxygenNote: 6.1.1
# Suggests: testthat (>= 1.0.2), knitr (>= 1.13), rmarkdown (>= 0.9.6), dbplyr (>= 1.2.1), DBI, RSQLite
# Imports: dplyr (>= 0.8.0), magrittr (>= 1.5), tidyr (>= 0.5.1), ggplot2 (>= 2.2.0), seriation (>= 1.2-0), lazyeval (>= 0.2.0), purrr (>= 0.2.2), tibble (>= 2.0), ggrepel (>= 0.6.5), methods (>= 3.4.3), rlang(>= 0.2.0)
# VignetteBuilder: knitr
# Encoding: UTF-8
# NeedsCompilation: no
# Packaged: 2019-03-05 23:50:40 UTC; edgar
# Repository: CRAN
# Date/Publication: 2019-03-06 09:50:03 UTC
smithy_version:
No azure token. Create a token and
put it in ~/.conda-smithy/azure.token
3.7.0
